org.openimaj.image.feature.local.keypoints

Class KeypointVisualizer<T,Q extends Image<T,Q> & SinglebandImageProcessor.Processable<Float,FImage,Q>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.feature.local.keypoints.KeypointVisualizer<T,Q>

    T -
    Q - 

    public class KeypointVisualizer<T,Q extends Image<T,Q> & SinglebandImageProcessor.Processable<Float,FImage,Q>>
extends Object
    Helpers for visualising (SIFT) interest points.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Method Detail

      • getPatches

        public Map<Keypoint,Q> getPatches(int dim)
        Extract the oriented sampling patches used in the construction of the keypoints. The patches are normalised to the given fixed size.
        Parameters:
        dim - the patch size.
        Returns:
        images depicting the sampling patches of each feature

      • drawPatches

        public Q drawPatches(T boxColour,
                     T circleColour)
        Draw the sampling boxes on an image.
        Parameters:
        boxColour - the sampling box colour
        circleColour - the scale-circle colour
        Returns:
        an image showing the features.

      • drawPatchesInplace

        public static <T,Q extends Image<T,Q> & SinglebandImageProcessor.Processable<Float,FImage,Q>> Q drawPatchesInplace(Q image,
                                                                                                                   List<? extends Keypoint> keypoints,
                                                                                                                   T boxColour,
                                                                                                                   T circleColour)
        Draw the SIFT features onto an image. The features are visualised as circles with orientation lines showing the scale and orientation, and with oriented squares showing the sampling region. The colours of the squares and circles is controlled individually. Setting the colour to null will cause the shape not to be displayed. The sizes of the drawn shapes assume the default SIFT settings described by Lowe. If the parameters used to find the keypoints have been changed, then the features might not be drawn at the correct size.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the pixel type
        Q - the image type
        Parameters:
        image - the image to draw on
        keypoints - the features to draw
        boxColour - the colour of the sampling boxes
        circleColour - the colour of the scale circle
        Returns:
        the input image

      • drawCenter

        public Q drawCenter(T col)
        Draw the centre point of the keypoints on an image
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getSamplingBox

        public static Polygon getSamplingBox(Keypoint k,
                                     float scincr)
        Get the sampling area of an single feature as a polygon.
        Parameters:
        k - the feature
        scincr - the scaling factor to apply to the sampling area
        Returns:
        the polygon representing the sampling area.
